rename.from: Test results BEP events are delayed when using `coverage` and Skyframe is enabled
rename.to: Test results BEP events are delayed when using `coverage` and Skymeld is enabled

body: @brentleyjones thanks for filing the bug. This is because of https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/commit/c2a6f0c38b75743158a3a8cbe7d6adf4202c2110. Realistically speaking I don't think I can invest time on this anytime soon. Is this issue blocking you or it's mostly an annoyance?

I originally filed this for a BuildBuddy customer. ~~That customer or someone from BuildBuddy will have to speak to that.~~

As for my new employer, this is a semi-block. We use these test results to report information to CI. Having these delayed greatly impacts our Time to First Feedback metrics.

issue.title: Announce combined coverage report on the BES

labels.name: team-Remote-Exec
labels.description: Issues and PRs for the Execution (Remote) team

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
This allows BES consumers to access this file without guessing its path and existence, as well as when the actual coverage generation action runs locally.

Also removes an obsolete `CoverageReport` event.

RELNOTES: The combined coverage report produced via `--combined_report=lcov` is now announced on the BES via the new `CoverageReport` event.

issue.title: Bazel 7 Skymeld Regression

labels.name: P2
labels.description: We'll consider working on this in future. (Assignee optional)

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
### Description of the bug:


Executing `bazel test //... --keep_going` on our repository when upgrading from Bazel `6.5.0` to `7.0.2` (or `7.1.1`) causes extreme slowdown.

Appending ` --experimental_merged_skyframe_analysis_execution=false` seems to fix the issue. Suggesting it's a problem with Skymeld. Note that we had skymeld enabled on Bazel `6.5.0` without problems.

The issue manifests as a very slow one-at-a-time execution with `checking cached actions` showing up on CLI.

Bazel profile is full of these:
![image](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/assets/666705/564b9a35-bfe1-42c4-90b7-beb2e1d9daec)

![image](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/assets/666705/db3d6c73-087b-4e89-8fa2-4d00d7e6249b)

and traces like:
![image](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/assets/666705/5c5af8a6-c007-47eb-9b51-ebe1a4c22410)

Looking at the JFR it seems like the time is spent here with a lot of map/string operations:
![image](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/assets/666705/232100d8-816f-476a-81bc-86c6366953ed)

![image](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/assets/666705/90ef8e23-f679-4461-afd3-799bb9c9a0a7)

The problem seems to be stemming from this semaphore [here](https://sourcegraph.com/github.com/bazelbuild/bazel@e60b8fb5f698e6566b85ce0ec01cab9a818c68a0/-/blob/src/main/java/com/google/devtools/build/lib/skyframe/IncrementalArtifactConflictFinder.java?L244).

We have a relatively large repo: `Analyzing: 175831 targets (74369 packages loaded, 764940 targets configured)` and I had to fix a bunch of things to move us to Bazel 7 so the bisect is not working great as the fixes are not backward compatible. I'm hoping this is enough for someone to know what's going on but happy to devote more time to identify the rootcause.



### Which category does this issue belong to?

Performance

### What's the simplest, easiest way to reproduce this bug? Please provide a minimal example if possible.


I do not have a reproduction right now. Our repository is large and private, I'm happy to try and create something but would like to get some feedback on the issue first.

### Which operating system are you running Bazel on?


Linux

### What is the output of `bazel info release`?


release 7.0.2

### If `bazel info release` returns `development version` or `(@non-git)`, tell us how you built Bazel.


_No response_

### What's the output of `git remote get-url origin; git rev-parse HEAD` ?


```text
It's a private repository
```


### Is this a regression? If yes, please try to identify the Bazel commit where the bug was introduced.


Yes, `6.5.0` seems to work correctly wheres `7.0.2` fails but I was unable to bisect cleanly.

### Have you found anything relevant by searching the web?

There seems to be bunch of reports around `checking cached actions` but they seem unrelated (like https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/21712)

I tried to search for Skymeld specific issues but only found the coverage issue [here](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/21475) which would also be a blocker for us to upgrading but is unrealted.

### Any other information, logs, or outputs that you want to share?

_No response_

issue.title: Do not delay `TargetCompleteEvents` with coverage

labels.name: team-Configurability
labels.description: platforms, toolchains, cquery, select(), config transitions

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
Baseline coverage artifacts are now requested in `CompletionFunction` to ensure that they are built before the `TargetCompleteEvent` is generated. This makes it unnecessary to delay sending these events until after a Skymeld build has had the chance to request all coverage artifacts directly, which could only be done after the analysis & execution phase, thus delaying events until the end of the build.

Fixes #21475
